name: User can still access subscribe as expected for some instance when they don't have permission on other connected instances

inline.description:
1. Login to Jira insane A
2. configure a test user in Jira that has create and browse permissions on only one project
2. Login to Jira insane B
3. configure a test user in Jira that has create and browse permissions on only one project
inline.expectedResult: User has browse and create permission on only 1 project in both Jira instances

inline.description:
1. Login to Mattermost as a test user who has system admin permissions
2. Connect the test user to both Jira instances by mapping the user as the Jira test user configured above
inline.expectedResult: Mattermost test user is mapped as the Jira user configured above in both instances

inline.description:
1. As the test user type /jira instance subscription edit
2. Click Add
inline.expectedResult: Subscribe modal opens and both instances are available

inline.description: 1. As a Jira admin, login to Jira Instance A and remove Create and Browse permissions from the target project for the test Jira user
inline.expectedResult: Test user no longer has permissions in any project on one of the Jira instances

inline.description:
1. Login to Mattermost as the test user
2. As the test user type /jira instance subscription edit
3. Click Add
inline.expectedResult:
On 2. Modal opens successfully opens and only subscriptions from Instance B are shown
On 3. Only Instance B is available for creating new subscriptions
